subject: Add helper function for Location and LocationType
commitMessage:
Add helper function for Location and LocationType

The location_util::getLocation is used to find the LocationCode
interface used for ServiceLabel. Also added logic to look for the
Inventory.Connector.X interfaces to populate LocationType.

For example, `Inventory.Connector.Embedded` means LocationType of
Embedded type.

Currently only support LocationType of
- Slot
- Embedded

Tested: No changes to redfish tree yet
Added unit tests

Change-Id: I7f2a8d6172e37dd72881fbfb5a9dfeaf83b2db09
Signed-off-by: Zhenwei Chen <zhenweichen0207@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Willy Tu <wltu@google.com>

Patch Set 36: Code-Review+1

Using string_view doesn't bring us benefits.

In case of string_view:
- If you pass const char* it is neutral, std::string will be created in line 69 and passed as const&.
- If you pass const std::string& it will be converted to string_view then new std::string will be created and passed as const&.

In case of const std::string&, object will be created only when parameter is const char*, in case of passing std::string we can avoid one copy operation.

Done.

In the cases of the other two functions, are those fine?
Yes, in case of getLocationType and isConnector std::string_view would be fine.

> Using string_view doesn't bring us benefits.

I disagree, and we use string_view to great effect in other places.  at the very least for consistency, I'd like to keep it here.

> 
> In case of string_view:
> - If you pass const char* it is neutral, std::string will be created in line 69 and passed as const&.

I'm not following this statement.  std::string_view has an implicit const char* constructor.  Why would that require a std::string to be created?


> - If you pass const std::string& it will be converted to string_view then new std::string will be created and passed as const&.
> 
> In case of const std::string&, object will be created only when parameter is const char*, in case of passing std::string we can avoid one copy operation.

Yes, you're right, this actually has some issues mentioned in common_errors.md.  Ideally getProperty should accept a string_view instead of a const char*.
I moved it back to string_view for consistency.
Done

For me default values are values I can skip and I will get correct result. In this case I guess that if you decide to skip this parameter and use default in all cases there will be redfish validator errors because response will be put into wrong place in json structure.

In my opinion this one should not be defaulted.
I have removed the default value.
Thanks. I have updated it.
LGTM
The `connectionName` parameter is documented as `service` in the comment above, while `path` is `objPath`. Please update either one of them. I think `service` and `objPath` might be better here.
Done. Thanks.
Unused header?
thanks. removed.
Please document this parameter
Done
Might want to add a case testing invalid capitalization
Done
Looks great!
friendly ping.

This is really odd.  On dbus bay/backplane is not a connector, and a connector is distinct from the item plugged into the connector.  Please add some detail in your commit message, and lets try to get to the bottom of the design.

It seems like most of it are not documented in https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/tree/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Inventory/Connector.

It is just from Redfish spec, https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP2046_2021.4.pdf?#page=28

I think Zhenwei@ added them. I guess to want to add them as different interfaces?

We can remove it for now and discuss more about it.
If those doesn't make senses, we probably should add them as different interfaces. Something like "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Location.Bay"?
Can you create the change to phosphor-dbus-interface and we can discuss it there?
let's move the discussion to https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/54025.
The linked patchset doesn't build.....  Did you expect it to?
I'll fix that change on the side. I have removed the connectors that's not documented for now.

Please follow the pattern we have elsewhere for this:

if "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Connector.Backplane":
    return "Backplane";
....

return nullopt.



We do this because there are many occasions where the dbus APIs don't match up directly with the Redfish APIs or we need to overload multiple parameters into a single redfish parameter.  I realize that's not the case here, but if it ever occurred in the future, it helps to not have to completely rewrite the logic.

Also, there was a lot of discussion on this way back when, and the above ends up generating smaller, more performant code (at least it did at the time).
yeah, I swear that I removed this before. It somehow came back and I missed it. 😞
Done
nit, generally when we pass this type around we use nlohmann::json::json_pointer, rather than explicitly declaring the template args.  Lets be consistent in that case.
Done
Thank you for writing unit tests!
Why does isConnector belong in this commit? It seems like that is separate from Location / LocationType.
isConnector is used for LocationType.
